article.title: Modelling interstellar structures around Vela X-1

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of object is Vela X-1, as indicated by the presence of a bow shock in these images?
What is the dashed circle in the left panel of Figure 1 believed to represent?
choices: The outer boundary of the bow shock
A Strömgren zone created by Vela X-1

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main difference between the information provided by the two panels of Figure 1?
choices: The left panel shows X-ray emission, while the right panel shows optical emission.
The left panel shows infrared emission, while the right panel shows optical emission.
The left panel shows a wider field of view than the right panel.
The left panel shows a deeper exposure than the right panel.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the filamentary structures (labelled F1 and F2) behind the bow shock in Figure 2 suggest about Vela X-1\'s past?
choices: Vela X-1 experienced a recent supernova explosion.
Vela X-1 passed through a dense molecular cloud.
Vela X-1 encountered a wedge-like layer of enhanced density.
Vela X-1 is interacting with the outflow from a nearby massive star.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information does the arrow in the left panel of Figure 2 convey?
choices: The direction of the interstellar magnetic field
The direction of motion of Vela X-1
The direction of rotation of the Vela X-1 binary system
The direction of the outflow from the Vela OB1 association

multiple_choice_question.text: What technique was used to acquire the data shown in Figure 2?
What information about the physical conditions within the filaments F1 and F2 can be derived from the spectra shown in Figure 3?
choices: Temperature, density, and magnetic field strength

multiple_choice_question.text: Which prominent spectral line is used as a reference point for measuring the relative intensities of other lines in Figure 3?
What causes the difference in the relative intensities of certain emission lines between the spectra of filaments F1 and F2?
choices: Different physical conditions within the filaments

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical quantity does equation (2) relate to the stand-off distance (Ro) of the bow shock?
